page.title: 06RURAL EDUCATION UNDER THREAT
page.content: Whitley Lower C & E (A) F & M School was built more than a hundred years ago for the education of children from Whitley and Briestfield. Over the years its roll has fallen until today only twenty children attend the school. This will fall even further in September l985 when eight children move to the local High School. As only two children are due to join the school in the foreseeable future, one in January l986 and one in September l988, the educational viability of the school is called into question. Is it possible for a two teacher school to cover the whole curriculum between the ages of five and twelve ? The arguments will continue, but closure seems inevitable. If closure happens then Whitley children will attend Thornhill First School while Briestfield will attend Upper Whitley
